post.description: This endpoint allows a new user to create an account by providing a name, valid email, and password. The email must be unique. Password must be at least 6 characters and no more than 64. On successful registration, the user receives their name, email, and an authentication token.
This endpoint allows an existing user to log in by providing a valid email and password. On success, it returns the user's name, email, and a JWT authentication token.
Ends user session by invalidating the access token. Requires valid Bearer token in the `Authorization` header.

get.description:
Verifies a user's email address using a provided verification token.
This endpoint is typically accessed by clicking a link sent to the user's email.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: The unique verification token received via email.

post.description:
Initiates the password reset process. A password reset link will be sent to the provided email address
if an account with that email exists. This endpoint is designed to give a generic success message
to prevent email enumeration attacks.

email.description: The email address associated with the account requiring a password reset.

message.example: If an account with that email exists, a password reset link has been sent.

post.description:
Resets the user's password using a valid reset token.
The token is typically received via a link sent to the user's email.

newPassword.description: The new password for the user's account.

get.description: Retrieve the authenticated user's profile information.

message.example: Successfully retrieved the user profile information!

photo.description: Optional URL to the user's profile photo. May be null. If provided, must be a valid image URL $anchor: and can be used to personalize the user's profile page.

get.description: Retrieve a list of all available categories for a user.

_id.description: A unique ID for the user in the database. Automatically generated when the user is created.

name.description: The user's full name. Must contain only letters (Latin characters), with a minimum of 3 and a maximum of 20 characters. Special characters and numbers are not allowed. This field is required for registration.

email.description: The user's email address, used as a unique login credential. Must be a valid email format and no more than 64 characters long. This field is required for both registration and login.

password.description:
The user's password. Must be between 6 and 20 characters. It must include at least:
- one uppercase letter,
- one lowercase letter,
- one number,
- one special character (!@#$%^&* etc).
Should not contain whitespace. Required for account creation.

balance.description:
The user's current financial balance represented as a number. This field is optional and defaults to 0.
The balance can be updated through transactions, displayed on the user's dashboard or profile page to show their current available balance in real-time.

photo.description:
Optional URL to the user's profile photo. May be null. If provided, must be a valid image URL
and can be used to personalize the user's profile page.

isVerified.description: The verification status of the user's account. Defaults to false. Indicates whether the user has confirmed their email address.

verificationToken.description: A token used for email verification. Generated upon registration and used to confirm the account. Defaults to null.

resetToken.description: A token used for password reset. Generated upon request for a password reset. Defaults to null.

resetTokenExpires.description: The date and time when the password reset token expires. Defaults to null. Used to set an expiration for password reset tokens.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the user account was created. Automatically set by the database.

updatedAt.description: The date and time of the last update to the user account. Automatically updated by the database when any field changes.

userId.description: A required reference to the user who owns this resource. Must be a valid MongoDB ObjectId string corresponding to an existing user.

date.description: ISO 8601 formatted date of the transaction.

type.description: Type of the transaction. Allowed values are 'income' or 'expense'.

categoryId.description: A valid MongoDB ObjectId representing the category of the transaction.

sum.description: The amount of the transaction. Must be a positive number.

comment.description: Optional comment or note related to the transaction. Can be left empty.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the transaction was created. Automatically set by the database.

updatedAt.description: The date and time of the last update to the transaction. Automatically updated by the database when any field changes.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the category was created. Automatically set by the database.

_id.description: A unique ID for the session in the database. Automatically generated MongoDB ObjectId.

userId.description: The ID of the user associated with this session. Must be a valid MongoDB ObjectId corresponding to an existing user.
